name: Bioconductor
description: Open source software for bioinformatics.

name: Bokeh
description: Python library for creating interactive data visualizations.

name: Ceph
description: Distributed, software-defined storage.

name: ChRIS Project
description: Open source distributed data and computation platform.

name: Confidential Computing Consortium
description: Advancing Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) technologies.

name: Ersilia Open Source Initiative
description: Developing AI/ML tools for biomedical research.

name: Fedora
description: Linux-based operating system.

name: Firefox
description: Free web browser focused on internet health and privacy.

name: GNOME
description: Free software desktop environment.

name: Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team
description: Humanitarian action through open mapping.

name: KernelCI
description: Community-led test system for the upstream Linux kernel.

name: Linux Kernel
description: Basic layer of the Linux operating system.

name: LLVM
description: Modular compiler and toolchain technologies.

name: Mboalab
description: Open and collaborative space in Cameroon.

name: Metal3
description: Software for managing bare metal servers.

name: ModECI
description: Standardizing model exchange across neuroscience and AI applications.

name: moja global
description: Software for monitoring greenhouse gas emissions and removals.

name: NetworkX
description: Python package for complex network analysis.

name: NumFOCUS
description: The mission of NumFOCUS is to promote open practices in research, data, and scientific computing by serving as a fiscal sponsor for open source projects and organizing community-driven educational programs.

name: OCaml
description: OCaml is a (high-level, typed, functional) programming language. The OCaml community contributes to the implementation of the language, as well as the surrounding ecosystem of tools and libraries.

name: ODK-X
description: ODK-X lets you build custom apps to gather, manage, and visualize your data just as well in the field as you do in the office. From cold chain management to longitudinal patient tracking to geographic data collection on mosquito releases, ODK-X helps you build your custom data management app.

name: OpenRefine
description: OpenRefine is a power tool to clean messy data. We have a vibrant community of users and contributors, with many training workshops organized around the world all the time.

name: OpenStack
description: OpenStack is an open source software for building public and private clouds. What does that mean? We're a collection of open source projects that integrate to help organizations deploy and run clouds for computing, networking, and storage (both block storage for providing volumes to VMs and object storage for storing objects such as images or music files). With OpenStack, you can control large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their users to provision resources through a web interface.

name: Oppia
description: By creating tools to enable the creation/distribution of high-quality scalable online lessons, Oppia works to make high-quality education available to those who lack access to it. The Oppia codebase is written using Python and AngularJS/Angular, and is built on top of Google App Engine.

name: Palisadoes Foundation
description: The Palisadoes Foundation is focused on providing equitable access to life opportunities for STEM education recipients.

name: Perl & Raku
description: Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over 28 years of development, making it one of the longest standing FOSS projects. Raku is a member of the Perl family of programming languages, formerly known as Perl 6.

name: QEMU
description: QEMU is a machine emulator and virtualizer that can run operating systems and programs made for one machine (e.g. an ARM board) on a different machine (e.g. your own PC).

name: scikit-image
description: scikit-image is a popular Python library for scientific image processing and analysis. It has been used in applications ranging from atomic force microscopy, to deciphering ancient scrolls, satellite imagery, and astronomy. We pride ourselves on high-quality, readable code, written and reviewed by an active community of volunteers.

name: systemd
description: A System and Service Manager for Linux.

name: Unstructured Studio
description: Creating learning for all.

name: Wikimedia
description: Wikimedia is a global movement whose mission is to bring free educational content to the world, via Wikipedia and other projects. Help improve our technical backstage!

name: xarray
description: Xarray is an open source project and Python package that introduces labels in the form of dimensions, coordinates, and attributes on top of raw NumPy-like arrays, which allows for more intuitive, more concise, and less error-prone user experience. Xarray includes a large and growing library of domain-agnostic functions for advanced analytics and visualization with these data structures.
